alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 17 at 5:02PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following counties, Apache and Navajo. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 500 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding has already happened or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Brown Creek, Rocky Arroyo, Silver Creek, Vernon Creek, Pulcifer Creek, Sepulveda Creek and Mineral Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vernon, Land of the Pioneers Trailhead and Little Ortega Lake. - This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between mile markers 350 and 364. State Route 61 between mile markers 353 and 365. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
